protocol_name: Fluorescence analysis of leaf discs using CF imager
protocol_name_html: Fluorescence analysis of leaf discs using CF imager
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Position the raised platform in the chamber, this can be done by rotating the height controller knob. 

 

The surface of the leaf should be 140mm from the base of the imaging chamber, and can be adjusted by lowering or raising the plant under analysis. As there are many leaf discs in each plate, and they may be at different heights. Estimate an average height for the leaf discs and use this.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Position the raised platform in the chamber, this can be done by rotating the height controller knob. 

 

The surface of the leaf should be 140mm from the base of the imaging chamber, and can be adjusted by lowering or raising the plant under analysis. As there are many leaf discs in each plate, and they may be at different heights. Estimate an average height for the leaf discs and use this.

components.data: Maually adjust the apeture as shown on the right to allow and optimal amount of light into the imager so as not to overexpose measurements

components.data: Set exposure
components.name: Section

components.data: Isolate each leaf disc as a seperate image
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Isolate each leaf disc as a seperate image

components.data:
Isolate the plant or leaf of interest. 

 

Click 'image' and the 'apply image isolation'. This will produce an image where each leaf disc is distinct 

 

 

After applying isolation background areas will be masked out in blue as shown below.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Isolate the plant or leaf of interest. 

 

Click 'image' and the 'apply image isolation'. This will produce an image where each leaf disc is distinct 

 

 

After applying isolation background areas will be masked out in blue as shown below.

components.data:
Remove residual noise from image

Sometimes the software picks up background noise as real signals, shown below as black dots on the blue background. It is advisable to mask these, otherwise they will be counted as a separate 'colony' during analysis and measurements will be recorded for each of these spots in the final data sheet. Noise can be masked by moving the cursor over the dot, pressing CTRL+left click simultaneously.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove residual noise from image

Sometimes the software picks up background noise as real signals, shown below as black dots on the blue background. It is advisable to mask these, otherwise they will be counted as a separate 'colony' during analysis and measurements will be recorded for each of these spots in the final data sheet. Noise can be masked by moving the cursor over the dot, pressing CTRL+left click simultaneously.

components.data: Begin the protocol
components.name: Section

components.data:
Load protocol by clocking the RED 'P' button. This will come up with an automatically loaded protocol, click 'Yes' when it asks for approval, and the protocol will begin. 

 

 

If a particular or different protocol is needed to the one already on the system, you can upload a protocol by clicking 'Settings', ',pcl (protocol) files', then 'load files' and select the one you require. This is shown in the image below:
components.name: Description

components.data: Export the data
components.name: Section

components.data:
Export data by clicking 'File', 'Save As', and selecting the folder and a name for the data entry. 

 

The image below shows an alternative way of saving the file.

components.data: Wrap the plates up in tin foil (to prevent exposure to light) for an hour. This can be done overnight but increases the risk of the plants going into stress.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wrap the plates up in tin foil (to prevent exposure to light) for an hour. This can be done overnight but increases the risk of the plants going into stress.

components.data: Dark adapt plants
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of Fluorescence analysis using CF imager
source_data.annotation:
This is done to ensure the photosynthetic electron transport chain is fully oxidized and reaction centres are open. In an ideal situation plants are allowed to dark adapt overnight prior to measurement.

 

A properlly adapted, healthy plant should give a Fv/Fm value of ~0.8. This has been shown to be highly stable between species. Significant deviation from this (e.g. <0.7) either suggests incomplete adaptation or stressed plant material.
source_data.thread_text:
This is done to ensure the photosynthetic electron transport chain is fully oxidized and reaction centres are open. In an ideal situation plants are allowed to dark adapt overnight prior to measurement.

 

A properlly adapted, healthy plant should give a Fv/Fm value of ~0.8. This has been shown to be highly stable between species. Significant deviation from this (e.g. <0.7) either suggests incomplete adaptation or stressed plant material.
source_data.body:
This is done to ensure the photosynthetic electron transport chain is fully oxidized and reaction centres are open. In an ideal situation plants are allowed to dark adapt overnight prior to measurement.

 

A properlly adapted, healthy plant should give a Fv/Fm value of ~0.8. This has been shown to be highly stable between species. Significant deviation from this (e.g. <0.7) either suggests incomplete adaptation or stressed plant material.

components.data: Start the FluorImager software by clicing the RED camera button. This will then activate many other options (buttons), as can be seen below.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Start the FluorImager software by clicing the RED camera button. This will then activate many other options (buttons), as can be seen below.

components.data: Begin using the Software
components.name: Section

components.data: Turn on the computer and scree. Then turn on the cf imager using the switch on the top right of the machiene. Open the FluorImager software which can be found on the desktop.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on the computer and scree. Then turn on the cf imager using the switch on the top right of the machiene. Open the FluorImager software which can be found on the desktop.

components.data: Adjust the image focus
components.name: Section

components.data: Set the focus by adjusting the dial above the chamber, and lock in position by turning the screw on the side.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set the focus by adjusting the dial above the chamber, and lock in position by turning the screw on the side.

components.data: Prepare leaf discs
components.name: Section

components.data: After each plate is full of leaf dics in the field, the plate should be wrapped in tin foil to prevent exposure to the sun, this dark adapts them.   When inside and in the dark, unwrap the foil and take the lid off the plate. Make sure that each leaf disc is horizontal. This can be done using a small tool (such as tweezers) which do not have a sharp edge. Double check that the underside of the leaf is facing down. Ideally, the leaf discs will all be at the same height, but due to the difficulty of creating sponges of the same size, the leaf discs may be at different heights within the plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After each plate is full of leaf dics in the field, the plate should be wrapped in tin foil to prevent exposure to the sun, this dark adapts them.   When inside and in the dark, unwrap the foil and take the lid off the plate. Make sure that each leaf disc is horizontal. This can be done using a small tool (such as tweezers) which do not have a sharp edge. Double check that the underside of the leaf is facing down. Ideally, the leaf discs will all be at the same height, but due to the difficulty of creating sponges of the same size, the leaf discs may be at different heights within the plate.

components.data:
Unwrap the plate and take the lid off. Put the plate into the chamber. Position the plate so that it is in the centre. Use tape so that it is easy to precicesly locate where the middle of the raised platform is. 

 

Use a dummy plate with which has leaf discs as a test for the height of the plate, the
